oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of an unidentified civilian male in coat with vest
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although the gentleman in the image is unidentified, the backmark of the CdV indicates that the photographic studio was in Madison, Wisconsin. The presence of the revenue stamp indicates that the image dates to the 1863-1866 time frame. Cartes de visite were subject to a federal tax between 1863-1866 in an attempt to raise revenue to cover the costs of the war.
